Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ValerieOct4
Reviews.Content: This little gem is in an excellent location for anyone wanting to trip around Stanley Park and Downtown. The kitchenette was well stocked. Room was clean. View very nice. Get to the breakfast early as it was mostly picked over by 8:30. Quick check in and out. Thank you David and Eva.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, GREAT”
Reviews.Author: parraboy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice now. The location is excellent, sweeping views of Stanley park, walking distance to the many shops & resturants. Staff are sensational, enthusiastic and actually care. Nothing a problem for them. Rooms are clean, comfortable & secure. Slept like a dream on the beds. Base yourself here.. if you here in September or the warmer months, hire a bike and so Stanley park and surrounds. This is a must... even walk it. So much to see and do along the route. GREAT CITY, Great Hotel.... Great people. Not that far was gastown or the Harbour..... We walked everywhere without a problem... Love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value and Right by Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: cdnshepdog
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right beside Stanley Park, this is a great location. There are bike rental shops just up the street and a grocery store. The one big down side, is the breakfast, which is included- Its awful. You are better off buying your own groceries and cooking in your suite. There is only one table in the breakfast room and you are lucky if you get a bagel. The rooms are very nice and spacious. The one or two bedrooms suites are perfect for families. Not the best location if you want to be close to bars and restaurants downtown. Fair value for families.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver base”
Reviews.Author: beevcat
Reviews.Content: Just reading these reviews and felt I just had to write- I have stayed here twice in the penthouse suites and would stay each and very time we visit Van. The location is great, views to die for and we have stayed on the Georgia side with no noise at all. Maybe we were too high, I don't know. We have stayed as a family of 4 and there was lots of room for us all and the 3 men are over 6'5" so space is an issue!. Internet, cable, cleaning all great. I cannot fault here. I have also stayed at the Fairmont, and the feel of here is so much more like being a local and having a condo here. They were flexible with us on travel dates changing at last minute also.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised...”
Reviews.Author: britishbynature
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were recently visiting the lovely Vancouver and made reservations for the Lord Stanley Suites. Having read some not so nice reviews we were skepticle at first but decided to give it a shot...and we're so glad we did!! The hotel is situated so close to Stanley Park that we could hear the ducks ;-) As for the suites, well they are cozy for sure...not sure if they would be suitable for more than two people ( which we were )so it was fine, the internet was very slow though and the telephones were a little dodgy ( worked sometimes...Concierge said they were in midst of being replaced so we gave the benefit of the doubt) Speaking of the Concierge there, David was his name and this gentleman was AMAZING! We weren't sure of the city and the things "Vancouverites enjoy" but David let us know IN DETAIL what and where to be, His personality and attention to ourselves as well as other guests we saw him dealing with was unbelievable...a real draw to coming back to this hotel for sure! The rest of the staff were also quite friendly but David definitely made an impresssion. There aren't too many extra's with the hotel, a small gym and average continental breakfast are a part of the rate...but the breakfast isn't much on variety. Still our stay was more than adequate and we look forword to visiting your lovely city again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base”
Reviews.Author: whereshalligo
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried reading some of the reviews but decided to go for it based on the majority reviews, and the price. Also we were only looking for a base to stay so internet, phone, gym, breakfast etc were not issues for us. We found the staff to be very welcoming, helpful and really put themselves out to help us. The lifts worked fine, and the suite was perfectly well furnished and comfortable. we did not use the a/c unit, even tho' we closed the windows at night - there was traffic noise - but this is a city ! there was no hooting or sirens unlike say NYC. The room was serviced every day, and very well cleaned and equipped. Excellent Safeway nearby and good choice of restaurants too. Bus services and nearly in Stanley Park. I could not say it was luxurious or hugely spacious, but it was fine for us. we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid during either hot or cold spells”
Reviews.Author: Norhtwestmom
Reviews.Content: Stay was during a heat wave. The air conditioner was at best minimally effective. I set it for 22 C- barely came down to 28 C at night - by morning 30 C. The air conditioner was vented through a cracked window that didn't completely close. I can guess that in the winter there is a bad draft and it would be cold. The desk clerk charged $20 for parking, took my $20 bill, then didn't credit it to my account, the girl the next day charged $27 (tax- accounted for the extra), wouldn't take my word for it that I'd paid the day previously. It isn't really an hotel. It is an apartment building that seems not to be able to sell all of it's units. At the bottom of the car park there are dozens of old furniture just like that which was in our room. I suspect that is why there was such a funny odor to the sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, amazing value, great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DrPixieP
Reviews.Content: Close to Stanley Park, nice view over downtown or the water, great price - 73 CAN/Night. Helpful desk staff, We had a one bedroom suite, small kitchen with everything you need, bedroom wasn't huge, but was fine, washer/dryer really handy with some detergent. 10 CAN/day for wired internet. Really no faults at all. Caper's whole food market and Safeway close by, really couldn't be better located. Check out the bike rental places and cycle around Stanley Park. Second time stayed there, probably wouldn't stay anywhere else in Downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but quite a disapointment”
Reviews.Author: Xolo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the month of January. It looks nice and has 24 hour concierge service. It has 2 elevators, but one is almost always not working; so you have to wait for the elevator constantly. The room came fully furnished, barely. I had 2 water glasses & 2 forks. Lots of cups, mugs and other cutlery, but I was constantly doing dishes to have a full setting. The "high speed internet" isn't high speed at all. A modem would have been faster. Plus it constantly kicks you off of your connection. The shower head was split and sprayed everywhere in the bathroom. So all my items that I didn't keep under the sink were wet all the time. The exercise equipment was so poorly maintained that the weight stacks stuck half way up. Mentioning it to the concierge didn't get it fixed, had to go buy some silicone lube to clean it myself (which I am sending them a bill for). Plus some of the equipment has broken welds and loose pivot anchors, so there will be a law suite any day due to negligence. They turn off the heat in the exercise room overnight, so expect to be freezing in the morning when you go to work out. The cleaning service comes whenever they feel like it, instead of regularly. Also, things seemed to go missing every time they came through. There were 3 light switches that did nothing. Plus there were way too many lights that only turned on with a button on the light. The telephones always hang up on whomever you are talking to as well as when you first pick up the receiver (I had over 40 calls dropped). The closet door was off the track, so it wouldn't open and close properly. Cheap wire rack closet rods, in the bedroom and hallway with only 2 hangers for the entire place. The sliding doors to the "office" wouldn't close properly. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone I knew, and I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NotDrDave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lord Stanley over Christmas, and thoroughly enjoyed it. It's only a block from Stanley Park in one direction, and two blocks from downtown in the other. The suite (311) was small but efficient, with a little sun room overlooking Georgia St. Traffic noise was barely noticeable in the sun room, and all but inaudible in the bedroom. One thing I liked a lot was that the different areas each have their own doors. You can close off the office, bedroom or sun room from the main room, which would be really helpful if there's more than one person in the room. Also, the front desk staff was courteous, efficient, and very helpful, especially when I had a computer problem. Since it's a suite, and you'll probably do some grocery shopping, I'll note that there's a good selection of plates and utensils, butt the microwave doesn't have a turntable. There's a Safeway a couple of blocks away. All in all, I had a great time, and will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Traffic noise on Georgia Street hampers enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: ybunny
Reviews.Content: When we booked here, we didn't know that some of the suites overlook Georgia St, which we discovered is a MAJOR highway, with constant loud traffic 24/7 (the hotel's address is Alberni St, which is extremely quiet). The noise really interfered with our sleep and overall enjoyment. It's a lovely place, but definitely book a suite on the other side of the building!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Week At The Lord Stanley?”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy474
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is spectacular, however, a first class building without air conditioning? So our room with windows facing onto busy Georgia St., was rigged with a portable A/C that didn't work making it hot and uncomfortable. The linens had not been changed upon our arrival. NO KIDDING! There are no housekeeping services evening or night. Continental breakfast is code for "don't expect much". No coffee. The machine was broken. Muffins too old and hard to eat and be sure to get there early to get one of the 8 or 10 pieces of fruit. It's a real nice building in a great spot but I can't help but get the feeling that it is a condo building with a rental pool that is managed poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lord Stanley Suites On The Park”
Reviews.Author: mnidok
Reviews.Content: Myself, daughter and two granddaughters stayed here for 5 days and it was wonderful. We had a great suite on the 8th floor. The staff were very helpful, the breakfast great, the rooms were bright and clean. Wonderful location. Would definitely stay their again. The Kelly family

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: zec
Reviews.Content: NIce Hotel with great location,safe,clean and big Suites with kitchen.3 awesome months in lord stanley suites on the park.Greetings to Managment from Croatia and Switzerland.thanks

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan86
Reviews.Content: I rented a room off a family member good job i did aswell as the rates are quite high for a couple of weeks but i have to say this hotel is in one of the greatest areas and cities on earth i've stayed here a few times and before the apartments next door were built you could see right across Lost Lagoon but now the views are across coal harbour marina and a spectacular view of stanley park even if you get a room facing downtown the balcony will provide you with the views, Denman street with an abundance of restaurants is a 30 second walk away (I reccomend the Mongolian, 4 dollars all you can eat lunch buffet my mouths watering now! Davey street and burrard street are all ten minutes walk away, this hotel is in such a prime location you'd be mad to choose another, I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this place not ranked higher?”
Reviews.Author: DLMcClements
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2006 and now again in 2008 and we think it is perfect. The location cannot be faulted, Robson and Denman Streets (full of restaurants and shops) are just around the corner, English Bay a 5 or 10 min stroll away and Stanley Park and Coal Harbour right on your doorstep. Not many hotels have such a fantastic view (see photo of view out of our sun room window). Our party consisted of 2 adults and 1 child, we use the office as a bedroom which leaves the living area free. The suites are not big by anyones standards but we feel adequate for 2 adults and a child. Parking is securely underground and cheap. Suites have kitchen, washer and dryer which come in really handy if staying any more than a week. No problems with any of the staff we encountered, some of whom we recognised from our previous visit, not many hotels retain staff for that long. We would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roughcrook
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a very hot August. Air conditioning worked very well and room had wonderful view over Stanley park. Staff very helpful and hotel well positioned for good eating places. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious!”
Reviews.Author: London1001
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to the Lord Stanley after Times Square Apartments (which are great by the way, and far superior) overbooked. I can't say how disappointed we were! The room was extremely hot when we walked in and we discovered that the stand-alone aircon unit had a hot air vent that was supposed to be out of the window, but was blowing on the floor! We called reception who said that they didn't have any maintenance until the next week; but bought up a roll of sticky tape and asked if we would like to fix it ourselves! My husband had a go at sorting it out but the room was still stifling, to the point that when we were packing the next morning, we had to leave the front door into the (airconditioned!) hallway open. The light in the bedroom didn't work and again, they didn't have anyone to fix it. The suite in general was poky and falling apart - holes in the walls, stains on the carpet. I would stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: DLK_Zot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lord Stanley Suites Hotel with my family, including (now) two young children, every summer for five of the last six years. Although this all suites hotel was probably designed with extended stay or business travelers in mind, we have found it to be perfect for our annual family vacation to Vancouver, B.C. Each suite has a full kitchen, washer & dryer, and is divided into several little rooms, including a bedroom, office, and solarium. We can put the kids to bed on one of the rooms and enjoy the fabulous views of the harbor. The location is unbeatable in the summer — just steps from Stanley Park and walking distance from its aquarium, beaches, and large outdoor children's pool. Bike rentals are just a block away. Nearby Denman Street is a restaurant paradise including several kid-friendly places. The hotel is quite comfortable and a good value, so don't expect a lot of luxury services. The hotel has a modest exercise room and free continental breakfast, but is fairly minimalist as far as amenities. The desk staff is helpful but not really a concierge. If you arrive by car, parking is conveniently located in the basement. The property is nearly 10 years old, and could probably use a fresh coat of paint here and there. Some reviewers thought the hotel was too hot. My guess is that was an isolated occurrence because we've not found that to be a problem in the 5 summers we we've stayed there. Instead, we have found the Lord Stanley to be a excellent base for our annual family vacation to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and sticky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A small but compact suite with office area ,kitchen, and small seating area overlooking the harbour.Lovely views but the heat in the room was unbelievable.The air conditioning unit in the room was tempermental and the windows would only open so far but the noise from the traffic and the never ending sirens meant which was worse noise or heat?Clean and nicely decorated complete with washing machine and dryer it was like home.More suited to a business person than a family of four.The complimentary breakfast was good and the croissants were fantastic.Only 15 mins walk from stanley park.

Reviews.Title: “Too hot!”
Reviews.Author: Hedgehog1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in July 2004 and were very glad to leave. The rooms are adequate, with good facilites which even included a washing machine. The location was good too - just on the edge of Stanley Park. However, we were overwhelmed by the heat in the rooms. The huge glass windows created a 'greenhouse effect' and the small air cooler in the lounge did not reduce the temperature at all. The outside temperate was 25c, so the problems must only get worse as the temperatures increase in the height of summer. We were unable to sleep both nights and compared to other similar hotels we stayed in the lack of air con was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Suites and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: tonymoco
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nearest, reasonably priced hotels to Stanley Park, and that alone makes it a wonderful place to stay IMHO. If you enjoy urban exlploring but need a natural refuge nearby to recharge/reconnect, then this is an excellent option. It's not really a full service hotel, but somewhere between that and a vacation rental. The front desk service is very friendly and helpful, but also intentionally limited. They have a website which accurately depicts the rooms. I can understand why another reviewer called them small, but for me the suite layout seemed spacious nonetheless. I'm not sure if every room has a balcony, but I enjoyed having one. Some of the views are spectactular. Again, just be sure you understand what you're getting into with the Lord Stanley: what it does, it does well...but it is NOT a full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place - a bit small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent 3 nights in one of the presidential suites (2 bedroom) at the Lord Stanley in late October 2002. The Lord Stanley is located very close to the harbor and one entrance to Stanley Park. There are many very nice restraurants, stores and shops near by - these are the primary reasons we decided to stay there. The rooms are small but comfortable and well appointed. There is a washer and dryer, dishwasher, refrigerator, full sized stove/oven, gas fireplace, and microwave in the suites. The 2 bathrooms were large - linens were standard, hotel - towels were nothing special either - standard hotel quality. We had heard from others that the air conditioning is not good during the summer - in fact it gets very uncomfortable in the rooms. We probably would not stay there in the summer because of that. Not all the rooms have windows that open so the only air would be provided by a circulating fan that is in the rooms. There is daily housekeeping service (late in the day). Both bedrooms were good sized. There is an enclosed office/sitting rooms for each bedroom and several balonies with wonderful views of the city and harbor. We were on the Alberni Street side and it gets alot of commuter traffic and can be noisy even 14 stories up. We found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay there again - in fact we plan to next spring. Four people is the maximum I would suggest even in the 2 bedrooms suites - mainly because everything is small(ish) and compact sized and any more people (or small children) would feel overcrowded.

HotelInfo.Name: Lord Stanley Suites On The Park
HotelInfo.Address: 1889 Alberni Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6G 3G7, Canada
